com.tsgrp.migration.util

Class NodeUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tsgrp.migration.util.NodeUtil

  • public class NodeUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Static utility methods related to MigrationNode objects. After initial development, any "success" logging was commented out to prevent the debug log from becoming too massive. "Exceptions" are still noted with logger.debug statements.

      • convertAttributeToDate

        public static java.util.Date convertAttributeToDate(MigrationNode node,
                                                    java.lang.String attrName,
                                                    java.lang.String[] parsePatterns,
                                                    java.lang.String defaultDate,
                                                    boolean stripCircaPrefix)
        Replace the node attribute with its string's equivalent value as a Date (single or repeating), or defaultDate if string cannot be converted.
        Parameters:
        node -
        attrName -
        parsePatterns - String[] of SimpleDateFormat patterns to try, in order
        defaultDate - Fallback date, must be in one of the given formats
        stripCircaPrefix - If true, strip leading "c." if present
        Returns:
        Resulting Date value (of first value if repeating), or null

      • convertAttributeToDate

        public static java.util.Date convertAttributeToDate(MigrationNode node,
                                                    java.lang.String attrName,
                                                    java.lang.String[] parsePatterns,
                                                    java.lang.String defaultDate,
                                                    boolean stripCircaPrefix,
                                                    boolean parseDateStrictly)
        Replace the node attribute with its string's equivalent value as a Date (single or repeating), or defaultDate if string cannot be converted.
        Parameters:
        node -
        attrName -
        parsePatterns - String[] of SimpleDateFormat patterns to try, in order
        defaultDate - Fallback date, must be in one of the given formats
        stripCircaPrefix - If true, strip leading "c." if present
        parseDateStrictly - If true, parse the date strictly
        Returns:
        Resulting Date value (of first value if repeating), or null

      • matchAttributeNames

        public static java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> matchAttributeNames(MigrationNode node,
                                                                         java.lang.String inclusionPattern,
                                                                         java.lang.String exclusionPattern,
                                                                         java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> staticAttrList)
        Examine the given nodes attribute and build a list of those that match the include and exclude patterns, as described in OmUtil.matchPatterns(String, String, String); always include attributes in the OPTIONAL static list.
        Parameters:
        node -
        inclusionPattern - regex of attr names to include
        exclusionPattern - regex of attr names to exclude
        staticAttrList - if non-null, attribute names to ALWAYS include, regardless of their presence in the node
        Returns:
        Set of attribute names, empty list if none match (never null)

      • matchCriteriaAttribute

        public static boolean matchCriteriaAttribute(MigrationNode node,
                                             java.lang.String criteriaAttributeName,
                                             java.lang.String criteriaRegex)
        Determine whether any of the node attribute's values match the regular expression. The comparisons are done as follows:
        1. If either criteriaAttributeName or criteriaRegex are blank or null, skip the check and return true.
        2. If the node does not have an attribute with the name criteriaAttributeName, return false.
        3. If at least one value matches, return true; otherwise false.
        Parameters:
        node -
        criteriaAttributeName -
        criteriaRegex -
        Returns:
        TRUE if node has attribute and at least one value matches, or if either criteria parameter is blank/null

      • matchCriteriaAttributes

        public static boolean matchCriteriaAttributes(MigrationNode node,
                                              java.util.List criteriaAttributeList,
                                              java.util.List criteriaRegexList)
        Determine whether any of the node attribute's values match the regular expression. The comparisons are done as follows:
        1. If either criteriaAttributeList or criteriaRegexList are blank or null, skip the check and return true.
        2. If the sizes of criteriaAttributeList and criteriaRegexList are different, log a warning and return false.
        3. If there is an attribute in the criteriaAttributeList that the node does not have, return false.
        4. If all attributes in the criteriaAttributeList match the corresponding expressions in the criteriaRegexList, return true.
          5. Note: this function does not support repeating attributes.
        Parameters:
        node -
        criteriaAttributeList -
        criteriaRegexList -
        Returns:
        TRUE if all attributes match, or if either criteria parameter is blank/null/missized.

      • matchCriteriaAttribute

        public static boolean matchCriteriaAttribute(MigrationNode node,
                                             java.lang.String criteriaAttributeName,
                                             java.lang.String criteriaRegex,
                                             java.lang.String excludeCriteriaRegex)
        Determine whether the given MigrationNode matches, given the specified inclusion and exclusion patterns. The comparisons are done as follows:
        1. If the criteriaAttributeName String is empty, return true. (if there is no filtering criteria, then this node should return true)
        2. If there is no inclusion pattern, ensure the input string is not excluded by the exclusionPattern if it exists. Return true if it is not excluded. (If neither pattern was specified, then true will be returned.)
        3. If we have an inclusion pattern, return false if the input string does not match.
        4. If we matched the inclusion pattern and there is also an exclusion pattern, return true if the input string does not match the exclusion pattern.
        The behaviour of this method for a repeating attribute is: if any of the repeating values matches, the entire node matches.
        Parameters:
        node -
        criteriaAttributeName -
        criteriaRegex -
        excludeCriteriaRegex -
        Returns:
        If given attribute is non-empty, not excluded, and included if inclusionPattern was non-empty.

      • matchCriteriaAttribute

        public static boolean matchCriteriaAttribute(MigrationNode node,
                                             java.lang.String criteriaAttributeName,
                                             java.lang.String criteriaRegex,
                                             boolean failIfCriteriaAttrNotFound)
        Determine whether any of the node attribute's values match the regular expression. The comparisons are done as follows:
        1. If either criteriaAttributeName or criteriaRegex are blank or null, skip the check and return true.
        2. If the node does not have an attribute with the name criteriaAttributeName, if failIfCriteriaAttrNotFound is true, return false, otherwise, return true.
        3. If at least one value matches, return true; otherwise false.
        Parameters:
        node -
        criteriaAttributeName -
        criteriaRegex -
        failIfCriteriaAttrNotFound -
        Returns:
        TRUE if node has attribute and at least one value matches, or if either criteria parameter is blank/null

      • updateAllNodeAssociationStatus

        public static void updateAllNodeAssociationStatus(MigrationNode n)
        Loops the all of a nodes versions and updates the status to Migrated. Called on the target to include all versions in logs.
        Parameters:
        n -

      • getNodeProperties

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object[]> getNodeProperties(MigrationNode node,
                                                                                       java.util.List<java.lang.String> objectTypePropsList)
        Gets a map of node properties
        Parameters:
        node - - the migration node
        objectTypePropsList - - the list of properties to get from the node
        Returns:
        nodeProps- a map of each of the properties in objectTypePropsList that existed on the node and its value
